daily_hygiene.title: Turn Off the Tap While Brushing
daily_hygiene.description: You can save 10-13 liters of water per day by turning off the tap while brushing. A 2-minute brushing uses about 15L if the tap is left open, and only 2L when closed.

daily_hygiene.title: Shorten Your Shower Time
daily_hygiene.description: Reducing your shower from 15 minutes to 8 minutes can save about 50 liters per person per day. An average showerhead uses 7 liters per minute.

daily_hygiene.title: Turn Off the Water While Showering
daily_hygiene.description: Turning off the water while shampooing and soaping can save 15-20 liters per person per day. It only means pausing the water for 2-3 minutes.

daily_hygiene.title: Turn Off the Tap While Washing Hands
daily_hygiene.description: Turning off the tap while soaping can save 12-22 liters per day. It makes a big difference over 8-10 hand washes a day.

daily_hygiene.title: Reduce Shower Frequency
daily_hygiene.description: Taking 1 shower instead of 2 per day can save 50-100 liters per person daily. Avoid extra showers unless needed.

kitchen.title: Efficient Hand Dishwashing
kitchen.description: Wash dishes in soapy water first and rinse after to save 20-25 liters per day. Controlled use is far better than leaving the tap running.

kitchen.title: Run the Dishwasher Full
kitchen.description: Running the dishwasher only when full can save 3-8 liters per day. Full loads are much more efficient than half loads.

kitchen.title: Wash Produce in a Bowl
kitchen.description: Wash fruits and vegetables in a large bowl instead of under running water to save 8-12 liters per day. Running water can use 15L; a bowl uses about 3L.

kitchen.title: Measure Water Before Boiling
kitchen.description: Measuring the water needed for coffee or tea saves both water and energy.

kitchen.title: Reuse Cooking Water
kitchen.description: Let pasta and vegetable boiling water cool and use it to water plants.

laundry.title: Run the Washer Full
laundry.description: Running the washing machine only when full can save 30 liters of water per week.

laundry.title: Reduce Laundry Frequency
laundry.description: Doing 3-4 loads instead of 5+ per week can save about 40 liters weekly.

laundry.title: Wash with Cold Water
laundry.description: Washing clothes with cold water saves both water and energy. Around 5 liters saved per day.

bathroom.title: Dual-Flush Toilet
bathroom.description: A dual-flush toilet can save about 30% water. Use the small flush for small needs.

bathroom.title: Toilet Tank Saver
bathroom.description: Placing a water-saving device in the tank can save around 20% water.

bathroom.title: Reduce Unnecessary Flushes
bathroom.description: Dispose of small waste like tissues in the trash to avoid unnecessary flushing.

garden.title: Water in the Morning/Evening
garden.description: Watering early morning or late evening reduces evaporation and can save about 20% water.

garden.title: Use Drip Irrigation
garden.description: Using drip irrigation instead of a traditional hose can save up to 50% water.

garden.title: Drought-Resistant Plants
garden.description: Replace lawns with drought-resistant plants to cut water use by up to 50%.

garden.title: Rainwater Harvesting
garden.description: Collecting rainwater can reduce tap water use for gardening by up to 80%.

lifestyle.title: Reduce Meat Consumption
lifestyle.description: Choosing vegetables/legumes instead of meat 1-2 days per week can save hundreds of liters of virtual water.

lifestyle.title: Sustainable Clothing Habits
lifestyle.description: Buying less but better quality items and choosing second-hand reduces your water footprint.

lifestyle.title: Use Tap Water
lifestyle.description: Using filtered tap water instead of bottled water reduces water use from production and transport.

lifestyle.title: Reduce Food Waste
lifestyle.description: Wasted food also wastes the water used to produce it. Plan portions ahead.

general.title: Upgrade to Efficient Appliances
general.description: Upgrading all water-using devices to A+++ class can save about 35 liters per day.

general.title: Low-Flow Showerhead
general.description: Using an efficient showerhead can reduce water use by 30%. Low cost, high savings.

general.title: Faucet Aerator
general.description: Installing aerators on taps can save up to 50% water. Cheap and easy to implement.

general.title: Regular Leak Checks
general.description: Check all taps and pipes regularly to detect leaks early. Saves about 15 liters per day.

general.title: Fix Dripping Taps
general.description: Fix dripping taps immediately. A single dripping tap can waste 20 liters per day.

general.title: Track Your Water Meter
general.description: Track monthly water meter readings to spot abnormal usage early. Around 10% savings.

general.title: Analyze Water Bills
general.description: Analyze monthly water bills to follow changes and set savings targets.

general.title: Build Water Awareness
general.description: Raise awareness of water-saving habits with household members. Small changes make a big difference.

challenges.title: Shower Time Challenge
challenges.description: Reduce your shower time by 2 minutes this week and see the difference!
challenges.challengeText: Reduce your shower time by 2 minutes this week and see the difference!

challenges.title: Brushing Habit Challenge
challenges.description: Make a habit of turning off the tap while brushing this week!
challenges.challengeText: Make a habit of turning off the tap while brushing this week!

challenges.title: Meatless Day Challenge
challenges.description: Skip meat at least one day this month and see the difference!
challenges.challengeText: Skip meat at least one day this month and see the difference!

challenges.title: Bottled Water Challenge
challenges.description: Use only tap water this week!
challenges.challengeText: Use only tap water this week!
